intro: Indosasa longiligula, commonly known as the long ligule sedge, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and related plants. The plant is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in spikelets. It typically grows in wet or moist habitats such as marshes and stream banks. Its botanical features make it an important component of wetland ecosystems.
